question: The "Ras Siyyan Peninsula" is located in which country?
explanation: Ras Siyyan Peninsula is located in Djibouti. It is located on the Bab-el-Mandeb Straits which connects the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden. This peninsula houses the seventh of the Seven Brothers Islands. It also houses Rocher Siyyan, an isolated while islet. This peninsula also provides habitat to mangrove bushes, seagrasses and sharks breeding ground.
